reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for a weekend in April and was overall pleased with my stay. We did have a very delayed check-in process (two of the front desk clerks simply walked away leaving only one person left to man the line of no less than 15 people checking in), but will assume that is not a common occurrence. The service we received during our stay by the employees we interacted with was all positive and appropriate.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in Up-and-Coming Area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are decorated in a nautical theme and were well appointed. The bathroom was fantastic with cool subway tiles and a large glass encased shower. I found the size of the room to be a bit larger than what I normally see in the city. There is also a very nice bar/restaurant in the lobby. We had a cocktail one night before heading upstairs and enjoyed the scene. Some other reviews mentioned hearing noise from neighboring guest rooms. I am usually very attuned to this and thankfully did not have that experience at this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, OK location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area is definitely growing as it used to be completely barren of any life. There are now many restaurants, etc. to enjoy and it's a great location on the harbor. I'm actually looking forward to going back next Summer to enjoy the ample outdoor venues in the nicer weather. However, if you are seeking the Boston hub experience, I might recommend staying in the Back-Bay or Quincy Market area.
reviews.title: Lack Luster
It's nothing special and there is nothing near by so plan on a taxi!
reviews.text: I used to live in Boston and we wanted to stay someplace in the city where we could walk to everything. This Renaissance is a gorgeous hotel, with a Starbucks, restaurant, bar, room service, etc. We were able to check in at 9:30am which was AWESOME! The only complaint I have is that our room was in the corner next to the linen closet that the housekeepers kept slamming the door and making a lot of noise. I also wouldn't stay here again if I was looking to walk everywhere, it was a little far to get to Back Bay and Beacon Hill, it is in great walking distance from Downtown though. If I don't care about walking and I plan on taking cabs then I would definitely stay here again, it's quiet and a beautiful, clean hotel. One of the better Marriott Hotels I've stayed at.

My husband and I decided to stay for 3 nights in Boston for our wedding anniversary. As soon as we got to the hotel, the doorman acted as if he was annoyed that we were even there and that he had to work.
reviews.title: A conference experience like no other.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent two nights before Christmas celebrating my birthday in Boston. I asked for a room on a high floor away from the elevator and got an exceptional room with a great view of Boston and the harbor. The room was well maintained and designed, the bathroom had a glass enclosed shower instead of a tub and shower curtain. The front desk staff was very friendly and so were the staff in the lounge and restaurant. The hotel is surrounded by restaurants with harbor views and within walking distance of two MBTA Silver Line Stations. The Institute of Conemporary Art is just a short walk away. We left our car with the valet for $42 a night but next time will park in one of the very close parking lots that charge only $30. We had a very good breakfast at "606" the in house restaurant, it was priced like most hotels but I did find that $4 for a cup of coffee was rather high. My companion liked it so much that she suggested we go back this summer when we can walk along the harbor.
reviews.title: A Room With A View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel. The staff is exceptional and very willing to help. It is a short walk to the center of Boston. Restaurant is fair but overpriced. Rooms are spacious and clean.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: First, we're Marriott members, so that played into our choice of this property. I was a little worried after some of the reviews here but was pleasantly surprised from start to finish. Quite nice inside, great bar area, large rooms and great location--the T stop is only about 100 ft. away (and it's the first stop from Logan airport, something I did not realize when I caught a $20 cab). I found it a great place to stay with one minor caveat. The runway at the airport is just across the water, and if the wind is right, planes take off almost directly overhead starting about 6:30 a.m. If you're there for work and have to get up anyway, no issue. If not, maybe this is not the hotel for you. Out of our 3 morning there, we heard planes overhead 2 mornings. But other than that, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Very Nice. Quite happy with our choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my wife for a few days while visiting friends in the Boston area.
reviews.title: Great, clean hotel close to downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived via airplane and took the Silver Line from the airport to the hotel since we wouldn't be needing a car for the first two days we were there. The World Trade Center stop on the Silver Line is just one block from the hotel, so that was very convenient. (I believe the Silver Line Way stop is also one block away, in the other direction). Check in at the front desk was a breeze! They gave us a corner room, which was a little more spacious than the standard rooms. The room was very nice. It had a king bed, sofa, desk and tv. We didn't need to access the internet while we were there, but I believe it was around $13 per day.
reviews.title: Not waterfront, but very close.

reviews.text: Full disclosure: First Reniassance I have gone to in the US, after a couple very pleasant and rather luxurious experiences in China. I'm not sure how their branding is positioned here or what should I expect from them.
reviews.title: $4 to bring up 2 forks....just ridiculous

reviews.text: This is a very nice, comfortable and clean hotel. Views of Boston are fantastic from the upper floors. Our room was spacious. Excellent location if you need to go to the Convention Center, and not terribly out of the way if you want to tour Boston. It's a matter of context, if you come from a big city, given the compact nature of Boston's downtown and historic neighborhoods everything will seem relatively handy.
reviews.title: Average hotel with 5star prices where every little thing costs extra!

reviews.text: I had this incident one night, however. My wife and I had leftovers from lunch at a nearby restaurant and we hate to throw food away, and I had just bought some excellent fruit at Haymarket to round a little dinner in the room up. I called to have a couple forks brought to the room, and much to my surprise I was asked if I had ordered room service. I candidly explained what was going on with my "dinner arrangements", to which I was told that it would be a $4 fee. Are you kidding me? Had we needed knives it would have been $8? Totally unnecessary disappointment. I'm still scratching my head on this one.
reviews.title: Even more impressed

reviews.text: Stayed here in Jan for several days the room was very average -- nothing special. A view staring into the windows of a condo complex across the street. Shades had to be drawn the entire time. No bath, just shower. Nice and large LCD tv. Water bottles were $4 each - usually you get 2 complimentary at other hotels.
reviews.title: Overall nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The business center -- 2 computers working (3 in all); very cramped and next to a noisy conference room, difficult to get any work done. Many people tried to walk in but all computers were taken. Wifi is available in the room BUT for an additional 16-20$ per day depending on if you want fast or slow WiFi. Found myself wondering if this should really cost extra with such a sub par business center.
reviews.title: New, Comfortable, Clean, but a Bit Out of the Way

reviews.text: The Seaport is attempting to become the place to be in Boston, but not succeeding much. This is where this hotel is located. One of many in the immediate vicinity of the Boston Convention Center. The area is still plagued with empty lots and parking garages. You are a stone throw away from the water, but it is barely accessible.. The shipyard is there. Lots of new restaurants are close buy. Legal Harborside and a couple of others in the same building are the latest addition but not worth it! The excellent Sam's @ Louis Boston is less than a mile away. Forget about Anthony's Pier 4 and no name. Pretentious is VERY overpriced. So when it comes to location, if you have to be @ the Convention Center pick this place if not stick to downtown Boston or the Back Bay.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Ok location depending on the purpose of trip.

reviews.text: The hotel itself is nice and modern. Nice staff, lobby is beautiful. The rooms are large and very clean with modern TV and nice linen. Aveda bath products are provided in cheap quantities. Not much of a view from the rooms. The WALLS are VERY THIN. I could hear all night the TV of the neighbor.. Torture!!
reviews.title: Pretty much enjoyed my stay

reviews.text: The gym is decent with few machines and treadmills. There is a 2 lane lap pool (probably 12.5meters) and a nice Spa facility and Sauna.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: Parking is by valet. 30$!!! hard to park on your own and then it's a small walk.
reviews.title: I expected a little more

reviews.text: Overall, again if you are on a business trip or need to be close to the Convention, go there, if not there are a lot of better located places in Boston. The seaport district is not ready for prime time and probably would need another 10-15 years to become.
reviews.title: Spacious and luxurious rooms, so so location
